Style modifiers

source

FT.append_classes

Append css classes to the FastTag element

Details




c

CSS class names to append




.padding

source



FT.padding

 FT.padding (all=None, **kw)

Add padding around the content within the element’s bounds. Defaults to p-4 if no arguments provided.




Type
Default
Details




all
NoneType
None
equal padding on all sides


kw
VAR_KEYWORD






# Test with different padding options
p(Div("Default", cls="bg-blue-200").padding())

 



p(Div("All sides", cls="bg-blue-200").padding(6))

 



p(Div("All sides", cls="bg-blue-200").padding(all=6))

 



p(Div("Top and bottom", cls="bg-blue-200").padding(top=2, bottom=8))

 



.margin

source



FT.margin

 FT.margin (all=None, **kw)

Add margin (space outside) to the element. Defaults to m-4 if no arguments provided.




Type
Default
Details




all
NoneType
None
equal margins on all sides


kw
VAR_KEYWORD






# Default margin
p(Div("Default", cls="bg-blue-200").margin())

 



# All sides
p(Div("All sides", cls="bg-blue-200").margin(all=6))

 



# Top and bottom

source



FT.corner_radius

 FT.corner_radius (size:str=None)

Round the corners of this element. Defaults to ‘rounded’ (base radius) if no size provided.










Type
Default
Details




size
str
None
Tailwind size suffix: ‘xs’, ‘sm’, ‘md’, ‘lg’, ‘xl’, ‘2xl’, ‘3xl’, ‘4xl’, ‘none’, ‘full’, or ‘[]’




# Default rounded
p(Div("Default", cls="bg-blue-200 p-4").corner_radius())

 



# Specific sizes
p(Div("Small", cls="bg-green-200 p-4").corner_radius("sm"))

 



p(Div("Large", cls="bg-red-200 p-4").corner_radius("lg"))

 



p(Div("Full", cls="bg-yellow-200 p-4").corner_radius("full"))

.shadow

source



FT.shadow

 FT.shadow (**kw)

Add shadow to element. Use ‘size’ for presets, or ‘x’/‘y’/‘blur’/‘spread’/‘color’ for custom shadows.

# Default shadow
p(Button("Default Shadow", cls="btn btn-primary").shadow())

 



# Custom color shadow
p(Button("Blue Shadow", cls="btn").shadow(color="rgba(0,0,255,0.5)", x=4, y=8, blur=8))

 



# Large offset shadow
p(Button("Offset Shadow", cls="btn btn-secondary").shadow(x=4, y=8, blur=12))

 



# Red shadow
p(Button("Red Shadow", cls="btn btn-accent").shadow(color="red", blur=10))

 



.opacity

source



FT.opacity

 FT.opacity (pct:int=100)

Set element opacity using Tailwind opacity- utility class










Type
Default
Details




pct
int
100
Opacity percentage (0, 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, …, 95, 100, or ‘[]’ as string)




p(Div("Full opacity (default)", cls="bg-blue-500 p-4 text-white").opacity())

 



p(Div("75% opacity", cls="bg-red-500 p-4 text-white").opacity(75))

 



p(Div("50% opacity", cls="bg-green-500 p-4 text-white").opacity(50))

 



p(Div("25% opacity", cls="bg-purple-500 p-4 text-white").opacity(25))

 



p(Div(
    Div("100", cls="bg-blue-500 p-4 text-white").opacity(100),
    Div("75", cls="bg-blue-500 p-4 text-white").opacity(75),
    Div("50", cls="bg-blue-500 p-4 text-white").opacity(50),
    Div("25", cls="bg-blue-500 p-4 text-white").opacity(25)
))

 



.frame

source



FT.frame

 FT.frame (w=None, h=None, halign:str='center', valign:str='center')

Position this element within a flex frame with optional sizing and alignment










Type
Default
Details




w
NoneType
None
Frame width: number (0-96), container size (xs-7xl), ‘full’, ‘screen’, ‘auto’, fraction, or ‘[]’


h
NoneType
None
Frame height: number (0-96), container size (xs-7xl), ‘full’, ‘screen’, ‘auto’, fraction, or ‘[]’


halign
str
center
Horizontal alignment: ‘leading’, ‘center’, ‘trailing’


valign
str
center
Vertical alignment: ‘top’, ‘center’, ‘bottom’




# Basic frame with size
p(Div("Content", cls="bg-blue-200 p-2").frame(w=64, h=32))

 



# Different alignments
p(Div("Top Left", cls="bg-red-200 p-2").frame(w=96, h=48, valign="top",halign="leading"))

 



p(Div("Center", cls="bg-green-200 p-2").frame(w=96, h=48, halign="center"))

 



p(Div("Bottom Right", cls="bg-yellow-200 p-2").frame(w=96, h=48, valign="bottom",halign="trailing"))

 



# Just width or height
p(Div("Wide", cls="bg-purple-200 p-2").frame(w="full"))

 



p(Div("Tall", cls="bg-pink-200 p-2").frame(h=64))

HStack

source



HStack

 HStack (*c, spacing=2, alignment='start')

Arrange child elements horizontally in a row with configurable spacing and vertical alignment










Type
Default
Details

Child elements to arrange horizontally

    spacing=8
))

    Div("Short").bg("blue-200").padding(all=2),
    Div("Tall item").bg("green-200").padding(all=8),
    Div("Short").bg("red-200").padding(all=2),
    alignment="center"
))

title: fhswiftui
text:
fhswiftui is a SwiftUI inspired wrapper for FastHTML and tailwind. fhswiftui is built on top of FastHTML and tailwind and will work with all FT components. Tailwind classes and FastHTML features work seamlessly.
FastHTML enables composing HTML apps by nested Python objects and tailwind is a CSS framework that provides standard CSS components. Since tailwind relies heavily on CSS classes to define components as well as include style information, this can quickly become complex and difficult to read.
For example, let’s consider a simple example of a turn in a chat which displays a user’s message with a timestamp. In FastHTML + tailwind, this would look like something:
fhswiftui provides layout and UI components. It also provides property setters that enable specific styling. The same example above using fhswiftui:
fhswiftui is built on top of FastHTML and tailwind and will work with all FT components. Tailwind classes and FastHTML features work seamlessly.
